intro: Oxalis dombeyi, commonly known as the Dombey's wood sorrel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Oxalidaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Oxalis dombeyi is also sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
